jobDescription: The HMDA-CRA Data Analyst is responsible for the oversight of the Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA) and Community Reinvestment Act (CRA) data management activities. Responsibilities include building monitoring controls and oversight program that ensures the bank operates in compliance with HMDA, HMDA Plus and CRA policies and procedures as well as applicable regulations and laws. The role is accountable for all aspects of the process including, but not limited to, ensuring completeness and accuracy of HMDA/CRA data reported; timely reporting to management and regulators; report generation for the bank's leadership team; promoting organizational awareness and assisting the CRA Officer in regulatory training. This position will also work to conduct periodic data integrity reviews, communication findings/recommendations with line of business, file geocoding, data scrubbing and validation of reportable data. The HMDA / CRA Data Analyst will assist in regulatory exams, internal or external audits facilitating HMDA and CRA file documentation requests. This is a high impact job that is responsible for the execution of a critical lending regulatory function reporting directly to the Bank CRA Officer. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSEffectively and constructively lead change in an organization, introducing continuous improvement and implementing practices that mitigate compliance, regulatory and legal risk surrounding the HMDA and CRA regulations in a large bank environment.Assist in the capturing, maintaining, review and in-depth analysis of HMDA, HMDA Plus and CRA data, interpreting it to monitor trends, regulatory requirements and identify possible risks.Assist in the annual regulatory submission of HMDA and CRA data to ensure accurate and timely filings.Establish strong partnerships and collaboration with relevant line management and deliver results in a complex matrix reporting structure to drive decision making through a consensus building approach.Assist in the data validation and remediation process on loan applications to ensure HMDA and CRA data is complete and accurate and validate all errors identified are remediated.Provide subject matter expertise with respect to HMDA, HMDA Plus and CRA reporting requirements and stay abreast of all changes in regulations.Interpret performance analysis reports, documenting the factors that are impacting the bank's performance, and
